newsitem.title: USA: Caltex says no decision on Australian holding sale.
newsitem.headline: Caltex says no decision on Australian holding sale.

text.p: Caltex Petroleum Corp said no decision has been made on selling down its stake in Caltex Australia Ltd, refusing to confirm market reports it plans to reduce the holding to 51 pct from the current 75 pct.

"Caltex is always examining ways to increase its value to its shareholders. If a decision to reduce our shareholding of Caltex Australia is taken we will announce it," said Paul Murphy, director of corporate communications for the Texas-based firm.
Caltex Petroleum is 50 oct owned each by Texaco Inc and Chevron Corp.
Caltex Australian has a 50 pct stake in Australia's largest petroleum refiner and retailer Ampol Petroleum Pty Ltd, which it jointly owns with Pioneer International Ltd .
